info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 6:31PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN GUERNSEY...MONROE... SOUTHEASTERN MUSKINGUM...NOBLE AND NORTHWESTERN WETZEL COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Caldwell to 14 miles southwest of Woodsfield. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Cambridge, New Martinsville, Woodsfield, Caldwell, Paden City, New Concord, Byesville, Dudley, Philo, Sardis, Senecaville, Pleasant City, Cumberland, Lore City, Summerfield, Belle Valley, Lewisville, Sarahsville, Dexter City, and Norwich. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 166 and 182. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 18 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Ohio...and northern West Virginia.
